sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
The prancing Swearer: or, perjury militant, an heroick poem. By C.M. M. C.
1 sheet ([1] p.)
printed by T. M. in Jewen-street, London : 1687.
Verse - "In that proud city, (to whose soveraign sway". With 10 lines of introductory verse, the first reading - "As Babylon of old was fertile grown". T. M. in the imprint = T. Milborn. Reproduction of the original in the Harvard University Library.
=======

printed by T. M. in Jewen-street, London : 1687.
Verse - "In that proud city, (to whose soveraign sway". With 10 lines of introductory verse, the first reading - "As Babylon of old was fertile grown". T. M. in the imprint = T. Milborn. Reproduction of the original in the Harvard University Library.
T. M.
